awd_titl_txt: RIA:  Inverse Interactive Computer Graphics Techniques for  Acoustic Visualization
awd_abstract_narration: IRI-9409834  Dorsey, Julie  University of Pennsylvania  $57,519 - 12 mos.   (Jointly funded with Cross Disciplinary                       Activities - Total Award $68,519)      RIA: "Inverse Interactive Computer Graphics Techniques for Acoustic  Visualization"           This is the first year of a three-year continuing RIA Award to  investigate acoustic simulation techniques to improve accuracy of  acoustic space evaluation, utilizing theoretical and interactive  techniques to indicate specific acoustical effects in a three  dimensional computer model.  By creating and altering these  effects, the surfaces, sound emitters, and geometry will be  indirectly modified.  The purpose is to have the system cary the  burden of searching the design space, allowing the user to focus on  the goals of the acoustical design rather than on the details of  the model specification.  The project benefits from analogous work  done in lighting simulation and interactive graphics techniques.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
